alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 17 at 3:33AM MDT until April 20 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS WITH AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Tuesday through Thursday continue to advertise a prolonged period of widespread critical fire weather conditions with strong westerly winds, low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. Tuesday will feature several hours of single digit humidity values, gusty westerly winds and high temperatures as much as 12 degrees above normal. While winds will diminish after sunset Tuesday, overnight humidity recovery will be poor nearly areawide, with most areas only recovering to 20 to 35 percent. Conditions are expected to worsen on Wednesday with strong westerly winds, continued low relative humidity and an unstable atmosphere. Widespread critical fire weather conditions will persist into Thursday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR TUESDAY IS CANCELLED... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. The Fire Weather Watch for Tuesday has been cancelled for the Middle Rio Grande Valley, Sandia and Manzano Mountains, and North Central Mountains. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), and North Central Mountains (Zone 120) below significant snowpack from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly 25 to 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent, except up to 20 percent above 8500 feet. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
